Excellent choices! Your guests are sure to love the bruschetta and spinach and artichoke dip as appetizers, and the popcorn with herbs and cheese and fresh fruit and cheese platter as snacks. It's a great combination of flavors and textures that will keep them satisfied until the main course.

And, absolutely, making grocery shopping a habit on Saturdays can be a great idea! Here are some benefits to consider:

1. **Consistency**: By designating a specific day for grocery shopping, you'll be more likely to stick to your routine and avoid last-minute trips to the store.
2. **Meal planning**: Having a set day for grocery shopping can help you plan your meals for the week, which can lead to healthier eating and reduced food waste.
3. **Budgeting**: Knowing that you'll be shopping on Saturdays can help you budget your grocery expenses more effectively and avoid impulse purchases.
4. **Family time**: Making grocery shopping a family affair can be a great way to spend quality time together and involve your loved ones in meal planning and cooking.
5. **Reduced stress**: Having a regular grocery shopping routine can reduce stress and make meal prep more manageable, especially during busy weeks.

Just remember to make a list before you go, stick to your budget, and try to avoid shopping when you're hungry to minimize impulse buys!
